title: Problems With the New Beta Client
body:
Hi Riot,

You made a great new client for League of Legends, but unfortunately, I cannot use it at this moment. Well, I could for a while, but it randomly stopped working after a specific game. I'm not sure which one, but I don't think that's important. It gave me an unfamiliar warning text box that told me that there was a problem with my connection, and that I needed to check my wifi for more information. I am currently using my college's wifi, so there was clearly nothing wrong with it. But it that wasn't enough of a red flag of this peculiar situation, when I attempted to log back into the client, it gave me the same text box again. I resorted to reinstalling my client, and now when I try to log back into League with the new client, it comes up with the warning message linked to this post. 

Thankfully, League still works for me if I do not use the new beta client, but I would sincerely like to go back to using it. Is there any remedy to this problem, and if so, I would like to know it as soon as possible. You guys did a pretty good job on that client and I would love to use it again.

Thanks,
Imbatross

replies.body:
I've seen this issue a few times when a reinstallation of the client went wrong. You should be able to resolve this by completing a *clean reinstallation* of League by following [this guide.](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/202539040-Reinstalling-League-of-Legends)

Let me know if this worked for you.
The client is terrible anyway. People w/ low budget computers literally cannot handle the animations and other things in the client. Kinda excessive.

I have an ASUS laptop. It's pretty old, but it shouldn't be causing these problems.

EDIT: Also, it's not that bad, it just needs a bit of touching up, which is to be expected seeing as this is a beta.
